Submodules¶

MultiLens.MultiLens module¶

class MultiLens.MultiLens.MultiLens[source]¶

Bases: object

this class aims to compute the lensing quantities of multi-plane lenses with full ray-tracing and approximation methods

analytic_mapping(lensAssembly, z_source, x_array, y_array, LOS_corrected=True)[source]¶

computes equation 29 in Birrer in prep with analytic terms for the LOS structure :param object_list: :param z_source: :param x_array: :param y_array: :return:

born_ray_tracing(lensAssembly, z_source, x_array, y_array)[source]¶

routine with Born approximation for all objects (eqn 14 in Birrer in prep) :param object_list: list of sources with specified physical deflection angles (sorted by redshift) :param z_source: redshift of the source :param x_array: x-coords of the rays :param y_array: y-coords of the rays :return: deflections delta x_coords, delta y_coords such that x_source = x - delta x_source

combined_ray_tracing(lensAssembly, z_source, x_array, y_array)[source]¶

ray-tracing routine with Born approximation for the objects specified (eqn 17 in Birrer in prep) :param object_list: list of sources with specified physical deflection angles (sorted by redshift) :param z_source: redshift of the source :param x_array: x-coords of the rays :param y_array: y-coords of the rays :return: deflections delta x_coords, delta y_coords such that x_source = x - delta x_source

full_ray_tracing(lensAssembly, z_source, x_array, y_array)[source]¶

full ray-tracing routine (eqn 10,11 in Birrer in prep), implemented with equation 12 in a recursive way (!assuming flat cosmology!) :param object_list: list of sources with specified physical deflection angles (sorted by redshift) :param z_source: redshift of the source :param x_array: x-coords of the rays :param y_array: y-coords of the rays :return: deflections delta x_coords, delta y_coords such that x_source = x - delta x_source

MultiLens.analytic_lens module¶

class MultiLens.analytic_lens.AnalyticLens[source]¶

Bases: object

class to compute the analytic terms in Birrer in prep given the lensing objects

shear_background_first_order(object_list, z_lens, z_source)[source]¶

computes Gamma^{C} matrix, equation 28 in Birrer in prep, which computes the distortion of the light rays between the source and the lens at the source plane with the approximation that the Einstein ring is thin and the source small :param object_list: list of sources with specified physical deflection angles (sorted by redshift) :param z_lens: redshift of the lens (main deflector) :param z_source: redshift of the source :return: 2x2 matrix

shear_background_zero(object_list, z_lens, z_source)[source]¶

computes ilde{Gamma^{C}} matrix, equation 23 in Birrer in prep, which computes the distortion of the light rays between the source and the lens at the source plane without taking into account the bending of the light rays :param object_list: list of sources with specified physical deflection angles (sorted by redshift) :param z_lens: redshift of the lens (main deflector) :param z_source: redshift of the source :return: 2x2 matrix

shear_foreground(object_list, z_lens, z_source)[source]¶

computes Gamma^{B} matrix, equation 23 in Birrer in prep, which computes the distortion of the light rays between the lens and observer at the source plane :param object_list: list of sources with specified physical deflection angles (sorted by redshift) :param z_lens: redshift of the lens (main deflector) :param z_source: redshift of the source :return: 2x2 matrix

shear_lens(object_list, z_lens)[source]¶

computes Gamma^{A} matrix, equation 21 in Birrer in prep which computes the distortion of the light rays at the main deflector plane :param object_list: list of sources with specified physical deflection angles (sorted by redshift) :param z_lens: redshift of the lens (main deflector) :return: 2x2 matrix

MultiLens.lens_assembly module¶

class MultiLens.lens_assembly.LensAssembly[source]¶

Bases: object

class to arrange all the strong and weak lenses along a line of sight

add_lens(lensObject)[source]¶
Parameters:lensObject – object class of lens_object.py
Returns:
clear()[source]¶

remove all the data of the object class :return:

main_deflector()[source]¶

selects main deflector object :return:

print_info()[source]¶
remove_lens(redshift)[source]¶

removes a lens at a given redshift, if existing :param redshift: redshift of removing object :return:

MultiLens.lens_object module¶

class MultiLens.lens_object.LensObject(redshift, type=u'point_mass', approximation=u'weak', main=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

class to specify the deflection caused by this object

add_info(name, data)[source]¶

adds info (i.e. parameters of the lens object :return:

deflection(x, y)[source]¶

returns the deflection of the object :param x: x-coordinate of the light ray :param y: y-coordinate of the light ray :return: delta_x, delta_y

distortion(x, y)[source]¶

returns the distortion matrix :param x: x-coordinate of the light ray :param y: y-coordinate of the light ray :return:

potential(x, y)[source]¶

returns the lensing potential of the object :param x: x-coordinate of the light ray :param y: y-coordinate of the light ray :return: potential

print_info()[source]¶

print all the information about the lens :return:

MultiLens.numerics module¶

class MultiLens.numerics.Numerics[source]¶

Bases: object

class to compute numerical differentials of the deflection angle

differentials(beta_x, beta_y, theta_x, theta_y)[source]¶

computes the differentials f_xx, f_yy, f_xy from f_x and f_y :param beta_x: source position in x-coord :param beta_y: source position in y-coord :param theta_x: image position in x-coord :param theta_y: image position in y-coord :return: kappa

gamma(beta_x, beta_y, theta_x, theta_y)[source]¶

computes the shear :param beta_x: source position in x-coord :param beta_y: source position in y-coord :param theta_x: image position in x-coord :param theta_y: image position in y-coord :return: gamma1, gamma2

kappa(beta_x, beta_y, theta_x, theta_y)[source]¶

computes the convergence :param beta_x: source position in x-coord :param beta_y: source position in y-coord :param theta_x: image position in x-coord :param theta_y: image position in y-coord :return: kappa

magnification(beta_x, beta_y, theta_x, theta_y)[source]¶

computes the magnification :param beta_x: source position in x-coord :param beta_y: source position in y-coord :param theta_x: image position in x-coord :param theta_y: image position in y-coord :return: potential

potential(beta_x, beta_y, theta_x, theta_y)[source]¶

computes the potential (modulo constant) :param beta_x: source position in x-coord :param beta_y: source position in y-coord :param theta_x: image position in x-coord :param theta_y: image position in y-coord :return: potential
